title: how in the heck can i hit vitals (from grand challenge) as fiora???
body:
got a sweet ass skin for her in a lootbox. so I decided to try her while she's on free rot.
but to my surprise, even though I found it easy as pie to last hit with her (before I started fps spiking, which I'm currently checking out) I felt like i was doing WAY better then I used to. The vitals behind the enemy are the hardest for me to hit (expected) so is there something I can do to make it at least slightly easier? 

going 2/8/6 hurts my heart (and both were killsteals)
{{item:3070}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

replies.body: Try being French while playing her and also eat a Baguette while doing it.
I tried inserting a baguette into my disk drive. But it was pretty small, so i guess it wasnt french enough

If you get a backside vital you can walk out of range of them and when you walk out you'll get a vital on the opposite side. 

Otherwise you can trade autos with them, then instantly q behind them to get the back vital, then kite back and hit the new front vital for a winning trade

if remember correctly, you get a MS boost when you break a vital, that plus the lunge should help.

Also riposte DOES break vitals.

Really??? 
Didnt know that. But i usually just saved it for some type of CC cause im just chicken like that XD 
ty

Right now im doing the klepto build, but in your opinion, do you think klepto, fleet, or PTA is better?

Try learning to play her properly.

Fiora is a very high skill champion if you want to go beyond auto attack dash spam, you need to learn how to attack while moving effectively and save your dashes to get behind targets or reposition.
Ah. I always dash to engage immediatley after i use grand challenge, but i never stopped to think if the dash might actually hit a vital behind the target
